item.title: Lisa add a quote by Kristin Kimball
item.description: "‎A farm is a manipulative creature. There is no such thing as finished. Work comes in a stream and has no end. There are only the things that must be done now and things that can be done later. The threat the farm has got on you, the one that keeps you running from can until can't, is this: do it now, or some living thing will wilt or suffer or die. Its blackmail, really." -- Kristin Kimball

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Raymond Chandler
item.description: "A man who drinks too much on occasion is still the same man as he was sober. An alcoholic, a real alcoholic, is not the same man at all. You can't predict anything about him for sure except that he will be someone you never met before." -- Raymond Chandler

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Christine Trent
item.description: "Die when I may, I want it said of me by those who knew me best, that I always plucked a thistle and planted a flower where I thought a flower would grow. —Abraham Lincoln (1809–1865) American President (1861–1865)" -- Christine Trent

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Adam Nevill
item.description: "It’s like you said, it’s all about P.R. these days. Brand management. Social networking. The corporatization of our own experience. We’re all our very own communications directors. But what a load of bollocks it all is when you’re faced by something like this." -- Adam Nevill
